ground_truth: As they pass Jude, she smiles, and outside the restaurant, Fergus marches Dil away. They pass out of shot, and in the background, Jude rises. Dil and Fergus make their way to their seats at the bar, where a figure is sitting down. She leaves, and Dil watches her go. She looks at Col, and there are tears in her eyes. She stands and staggers out of the pub. Fergus sits there, with an expression in Col's eyes making Fergus feel very small. Fergus rises and walks out, looking toward where Jude is waiting. Jude grabs his arm and draws him down an alley where the same car is waiting, and they get inside. Dil, sitting inside a taxi, watches Fergus and Jude getting in the car. Jude is driving, with Maguire next to her, and Fergus sits in the back. Maguire stubs his cigarette out on Fergus's hand and hits him on the teeth with his fist. Jude drives, and the car halts in a sedate square. Several doors down is an entrance to what looks like a sedate conservative club. In the car, Maguire turns off the engine, nodding toward the building and a Daimler parked away. Fergus looks from the window to the car, and Jude turns to look at him. Jude and Fergus get out of the car and walk down the street to a cafe-bar with tables outside, across from the brothel-cum-club. Fergus and Jude cross the street and take their seats by the tables, with the brothel visible down the way. She checks her watch, and Fergus is sweating. Down by the brothel, the door swings open, and Fergus walks down toward it. An old, portly gent in a suit emerges, and the car by the pavement activates and its door opens. Fergus quickens his pace, with Jude watching from the cafe. Fergus reaches the car before the gent does and passes between him and the open door, brushing the gent's stomach with his elbow. Fergus walks on as the old man is eased inside the Daimler, which then pulls off. After it passes Fergus, he turns around and walks back. Jude smiles and leaps up as he approaches, then begins to walk away, as Fergus turns to see Dil in front of the cafe.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: As they proceed past Jude, she grins, and outside the eatery, Fergus strides Dil away. They proceed out of view, and in the background, Jude ascends. Dil and Fergus make their way to their spots at the tavern, where a person is sitting down. She departs, and Dil observes her leave. She glances at Col, and there are sobs in her eyes. She stands and staggers out of the bar. Fergus sits there, with a look in Col's eyes making Fergus feel very insignificant. Fergus ascends and strolls out, gazing toward where Jude is waiting. Jude seizes his limb and pulls him down an alley where the same automobile is waiting, and they get inside. Dil, sitting inside a cab, observes Fergus and Jude getting in the vehicle. Jude is operating, with Maguire next to her, and Fergus sits in the rear. Maguire extinguishes his cigarette on Fergus's hand and strikes him on the mouth with his knuckles. Jude operates, and the vehicle stops in a tranquil square. Several doorways down is an entrance to what appears like a tranquil conventional club. In the vehicle, Maguire switches off the motor, nodding toward the structure and a Daimler parked away. Fergus gazes from the window to the vehicle, and Jude turns to gaze at him. Jude and Fergus get out of the vehicle and stroll down the road to a cafe with tables outside, across from the brothel-cum-club. Fergus and Jude traverse the road and take their spots by the tables, with the brothel visible down the path. She checks her timepiece, and Fergus is perspiring. Down by the brothel, the entrance swings open, and Fergus strolls down toward it. An old, corpulent gent in a suit emerges, and the vehicle by the walkway activates and its door opens. Fergus accelerates his stride, with Jude observing from the cafe. Fergus reaches the vehicle before the gent does and passes between him and the open door, brushing the gent's abdomen with his elbow. Fergus strolls on as the old man is eased inside the Daimler, which then pulls away. After it proceeds past Fergus, he turns around and strolls back. Jude grins and jumps up as he approaches, then begins to stroll away, as Fergus turns to see Dil in front of the cafe.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: As Jude is passed by them, she smiles, and Dil is marched away from the restaurant by Fergus. They are passed out of shot, and in the background, Jude rises. Their seats at the bar are made their way to by Dil and Fergus, where a figure is sitting down. She leaves, and her departure is watched by Dil. Col is looked at by her, and tears are in her eyes. She stands and staggers out of the pub. An expression in Col's eyes makes Fergus feel very small as he sits there. Fergus rises and walks out, looking toward where Jude is waiting. Fergus's arm is grabbed by Jude, and he is drawn down an alley where the same car is waiting, and they get inside. Fergus and Jude are watched getting in the car by Dil, who is sitting inside a taxi. The car is driven by Jude, with Maguire next to her, and Fergus sits in the back. Maguire stubs his cigarette out on Fergus's hand and hits him on the teeth with his fist. The car is driven by Jude, and it halts in a sedate square. Several doors down is an entrance to what appears to be a sedate conservative club. The engine is turned off by Maguire in the car, and the building and a Daimler parked away are nodded toward by him. The window is looked out of by Fergus to the car, and Jude turns to look at him. The car is exited by Jude and Fergus, and the street is walked down to a cafe-bar with tables outside, across from the brothel-cum-club. Jude and Fergus cross the street and take their seats by the tables, with the brothel visible down the way. Her watch is checked by her, and Fergus is sweating. Down by the brothel, the door swings open, and it is walked toward by Fergus. An old, portly gent in a suit emerges, and the car by the pavement activates, and its door opens. His pace is quickened by Fergus, with Jude watching from the cafe. The car is reached by Fergus before the gent does, and between him and the open door, he passes, brushing the gent's stomach with his elbow. Fergus walks on as the old man is eased inside the Daimler, which then pulls off. After it passes Fergus, he turns around and walks back. Jude smiles and leaps up as he approaches, then begins to walk away as Dil is turned to see by Fergus in front of the cafe.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: As they pass Jude, she smiles, and outside the restaurant, Fergus leads Dil away. Off-camera, Jude rises. Dil and Fergus reach the bar, where a figure departs. Dil watches her leave, tears in her eyes. She stands and exits the pub unsteadily. Fergus remains, feeling insignificant due to Col's expression. He gets up, heads out, and sees Jude waiting. She pulls him into an alley where a car waits, and they enter. In a taxi, Dil observes Fergus and Jude entering the car, with Jude driving and Maguire next to her, Fergus in back. Maguire stubs a cigarette on Fergus's hand, punching his teeth. Jude stops in a quiet square near a conservative club. Maguire turns off the engine, nodding at the building and a parked Daimler. Fergus glances outside; he and Jude exit, walking to a cafe-bar near the brothel-club. At their table, Jude checks her watch as Fergus sweats. The brothel door opens, and Fergus heads there. A portly old man in a suit emerges, the car activates, and its door opens. Fergus hurries, Jude watching from the cafe. Fergus reaches the car before the man, brushing his stomach with his elbow. Fergus walks on, and the man is ushered into the Daimler, which departs. Once it passes, Fergus returns. Jude smiles, leaps up as he nears, then begins to walk away as Fergus spots Dil by the cafe.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: As they pass Jude, she smiles. Fergus marches Dil away from the restaurant, and Jude rises in the background. Dil and Fergus arrive at the bar, where she watches a departing figure, then looks tearfully at Col. She stands and staggers out as Fergus sits, feeling small due to Col's expression. Fergus rises, walks out toward Jude, and she pulls him to an alley where they get into a waiting car. Dil, in a taxi, watches. Jude drives with Maguire beside her and Fergus in the back. Maguire stubs a cigarette on Fergus's hand and punches his teeth. They stop in a square near a conservative club. Maguire nods toward the building and a parked Daimler as Fergus looks out the window. Jude and Fergus exit the car, cross to a cafe-bar opposite the club, and sit outside. She checks her watch, with Fergus sweating. The brothel door opens, and Fergus approaches. An old man emerges; Fergus quickens his pace, brushes past him, and the man is helped into the Daimler, which departs. Fergus turns back, Jude smiles and jumps up as he nears, walks away, and Fergus sees Dil in front of the cafe.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As they move past Jude, she offers a pleasant smile, and outside the lively restaurant, Fergus briskly leads Dil away with determination. They disappear from view, and in the backdrop, Jude stands up. Dil and Fergus make their way over to their seats at the bustling bar, where they notice a figure sitting down comfortably. She gets up and leaves, and Dil's eyes follow her as she departs. With tears welling up in her eyes, she looks intently at Col. Overcome with emotion, she stands up abruptly and makes her way unsteadily out of the crowded pub. Meanwhile, Fergus remains seated, feeling diminutive under the weighted gaze of Col's eyes. Eventually, Fergus rises to his feet and exits, directing his attention toward where Jude is waiting. Jude grasps his arm firmly and leads him into a narrow alley, where the familiar car is waiting for them, and they both get inside. Meanwhile, Dil, seated inside a taxi, intently observes Fergus and Jude as they get into the car. Jude takes the driver's seat, with Maguire situated right next to her, and Fergus settles into the back. In a sudden act of intimidation, Maguire extinguishes his cigarette on Fergus's hand and delivers a blow to his teeth with a clenched fist. Jude continues driving until the car comes to a stop in a calm, peaceful square. A short distance away is an entrance to a building that resembles a conservative club. In the stillness of the car, Maguire turns off the engine, gesturing toward the building and a Daimler parked at a distance. Fergus gazes out of the window, alternately eyeing the car and then looking back toward Jude. Together, Jude and Fergus exit the vehicle and stroll down the street to a charming café-bar with inviting tables set outside, directly across from the brothel-turned-club. Fergus and Jude proceed across the street and take their seats by the outdoor tables, with the brothel plainly visible farther down. Jude checks the time on her watch, while Fergus appears noticeably anxious, beads of sweat forming on his brow. Down by the brothel, the entrance door swings wide open, prompting Fergus to begin walking briskly toward it. As an elderly, stout gentleman clad in a formal suit emerges, the nearby car by the pavement springs to life, its door opening smoothly. Picking up his pace, Fergus hastens forward while Jude watches intently from the café. Fergus reaches the car quickly, getting there before the elderly gentleman, and skillfully maneuvers between him and the open car door, inadvertently brushing against the gentleman’s stomach with his elbow. Fergus continues walking as the elderly man is gently assisted into the Daimler, which then glides away. After it has passed, Fergus pivots and retraces his steps back. Jude greets him with a jubilant smile and leaps up as he draws near, then casually begins to walk away, as Fergus turns around to find Dil standing in front of the café.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As they make their way past Jude, she warmly flashes a pleasant and inviting smile, and just outside the lively and bustling restaurant, Fergus takes Dil by the arm and briskly leads her away with a clear sense of determination and intent. They soon vanish from sight, and in the background, Jude rises from her stance. Dil and Fergus eventually find themselves heading over to their seats at the bustling and energetic bar, where their attention is drawn to a familiar figure comfortably seated nearby. The woman then stands up and departs, and Dil's eyes instinctively follow her as she makes her exit. Overcome with mounting emotions, tears begin to well up in her eyes as she turns to gaze intently at Col. Filled with intense emotion, she abruptly rises from her seat and unsteadily makes her way out of the crowded and noisy pub. In the meantime, Fergus remains seated, feeling notably small and insignificant under Col's weighted and penetrating gaze. Eventually, Fergus pushes himself to his feet and exits, directing his attention toward the spot where Jude is patiently waiting. Jude then firmly grasps his arm and leads him decisively into a narrow alley, where the familiar car is already waiting for them. They both then get into the vehicle. Meanwhile, Dil, now seated in the back of a taxi, watches intently as Fergus and Jude get into the car. Jude takes her place in the driver's seat, with Maguire positioned right next to her, while Fergus settles himself in the back. In a sudden and intimidating act, Maguire extinguishes his cigarette on Fergus's hand and delivers a harsh blow to his teeth with a tightly clenched fist. Jude continues driving until the car eventually comes to a halt in a calm and peaceful square. A short distance away stands the entrance to a building that bears the appearance of a conservative club. In the stillness of the car, Maguire turns off the engine, gesturing subtly toward the building and a Daimler parked at a slight distance. Fergus gazes out of the window, his eyes alternating between the car and back to Jude. Together, Jude and Fergus exit the vehicle and stroll leisurely down the street to a charming café-bar with inviting tables beautifully arranged outside, directly across from the brothel that has since transformed into a club. Fergus and Jude proceed across the street and take their seats by the outdoor tables, with the brothel-turned-club plainly visible farther down. Jude checks the time on her watch, while Fergus appears noticeably anxious, with beads of sweat forming on his brow. Down by the brothel, the entrance door swings wide open, prompting Fergus to begin walking briskly toward it. As an elderly, stout gentleman clad in a formal suit emerges, the nearby car parked by the pavement springs eagerly to life, its door opening smoothly. Hurrying forward, Fergus picks up his pace and makes his way quickly, reaching the car before the elderly gentleman arrives. He skillfully maneuvers between the man and the open car door, inadvertently brushing his elbow gently against the gentleman’s stomach. Fergus continues walking as the elderly man is gently assisted into the Daimler, which then glides away smoothly. After it has passed, Fergus pivots and retraces his steps back. Jude greets him with a jubilant and cheerful smile, leaping up with excitement as he draws near, then casually begins to walk away. As Fergus turns around, he is taken aback to find Dil standing right in front of the café.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As they move past Jude, she offers a warm smile, and outside the lively restaurant, Fergus firmly takes Dil by the arm and leads her away with purposeful steps. They continue their march until they disappear from view, drifting out of the scene, while in the backdrop, Jude slowly rises from her seat. Dil and Fergus then proceed to a more secluded area, finding their seats at a lively bar, where another figure occupies a nearby chair. This individual, after a moment, stands gracefully and leaves, prompting Dil to watch her departure with a lingering gaze. With deep emotion brimming in her eyes, she shifts her focus to Col, and tears begin to form, glistening as they cling to her eyelids. Overcome with emotion, Dil stands unsteadily, her feet stumbling as she makes her way out of the pub in a staggered fashion. Meanwhile, Fergus remains seated, feeling increasingly insignificant under the penetrating gaze that Col directs at him, the weight of the look almost palpable. Deciding it is time to leave, Fergus rises from his chair, consciously lifting his body and mind from the smallness he feels, and exits the scene, setting his sights on Jude, who waits patiently in the distance. With brisk movements, Jude reaches out and grabs his arm, pulling him with subtle urgency into a narrow alleyway where a familiar car is parked, ready for them. They both climb into the vehicle, with precision and speed, each taking their designated seats—Jude at the wheel, and Maguire settled next to her, while Fergus assumes his place in the back seat. Dil, now situated in a taxi, watches through the window as Fergus and Jude enter the car, observing them with a detached interest. Jude, focused and intent, starts the engine and begins the drive, with Maguire beside her holding a menacing air. Suddenly, Maguire, with deliberate malice, extinguishes his cigarette on Fergus’s hand, leaving a painful mark, then swiftly delivers a blow to Fergus's teeth with his fist, adding insult to injury with calculated force. Jude continues to drive, and the car comes to a smooth stop in a tranquil square, an area characterized by its calm and composed atmosphere. Not far from where they have parked, a conservative club’s entrance subtly beckons. Inside the car, Maguire, with a calculated gesture, turns off the engine, silently directing Fergus's attention toward the building and a parked Daimler further away. Fergus peers out of the window, shifting his gaze between the imposing structure and the dark vehicle, while Jude turns to look at him, a silent exchange passing between them. Exiting the car with composed movements, Jude and Fergus walk down the street purposefully, making their way to a nearby cafe-bar with outdoor tables, conveniently situated across from the mysterious brothel-cum-club. As they cross the street, they select their seats at the table, positioning themselves strategically with the brothel clearly visible in the distance. Jude, checking her watch with slight impatience, observes Fergus who is becoming visibly nervous, beads of sweat forming on his brow. Down at the brothel, the door swings open with a creak, signaling Fergus to make his move. He walks decisively toward it, increasing his pace as he approaches. At that moment, an older, portly gentleman attired in a suit emerges, heading toward the Daimler, its door invitingly open as if waiting for him. Fergus, sensing urgency, quickens his pace, keenly aware of Jude’s watchful eyes from the cafe. Arriving at the car just before the portly gentleman, Fergus deftly maneuvers between him and the open door, his elbow gently brushing against the gentleman’s stomach in passing, an action seemingly filled with both haste and intention. Fergus continues his stride, leaving the old man to be carefully assisted into the waiting Daimler, which immediately departs once its passenger is secured. After the car passes by, Fergus turns on his heels and retraces his steps back towards the cafe, where Jude eagerly smiles and leaps up in warm greeting as he approaches, exuding a sense of relief or accomplishment. Jude then immediately begins to walk away, a departure filled with a silent understanding, while Fergus turns his attention to a new presence—Dil, standing resolute in front of the cafe.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jude smiles at Fergus as she and Fergus exit the restaurant, leaving Jude behind. They proceed to the bar, where a woman departs, leaving Dil emotional and teary-eyed. Dil stands, staggers out, and Fergus feels diminished by Col's gaze. Fergus leaves and meets Jude, who leads him down an alley to a waiting car, observed by Dil from a taxi. Jude drives with Maguire next to her and Fergus in the back. Maguire extinguishes a cigarette on Fergus's hand and hits him. They arrive at a square near a conservative club, where Maguire gestures toward the building and a parked Daimler. Jude and Fergus leave the car and head to a cafe-bar across from the club. As Jude checks her watch, a sweating Fergus watches the brothel entrance. The door opens, and Fergus approaches as an old gentleman appears, intercepting him at the car door. Fergus continues walking, and the gentleman is ushered into the Daimler, which drives away. Fergus pivots back to the cafe, where Jude, smiling, stands to leave, revealing Dil's presence in front of the cafe.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As they pass Jude, she smiles a knowing smile, and outside the bustling London restaurant, known for its live jazz music, Fergus marches Dil away. They pass out of shot, and in the background, Jude rises, her silhouette framed against the glow of streetlamps. Dil and Fergus make their way to their seats at the bar, where a figure is sitting down. She leaves, and Dil watches her go, feeling the weight of unspoken words. She looks at Col, and there are tears in her eyes, a reflection of a conversation they once had about love and loss. She stands and staggers out of the historic pub that dates back to the 19th century. Fergus sits there, with an expression in Col's eyes making Fergus feel very small, reminiscent of a child scolded by a parent. Fergus rises and walks out, looking toward where Jude is waiting by the alley that cuts through the heart of Soho. Jude grabs his arm and draws him down an alley where the same car, a nondescript black sedan often used for discreet meetings, is waiting, and they get inside. Dil, sitting inside a taxi that has seen better days, watches Fergus and Jude getting in the car. Jude is driving, with Maguire, a notorious figure known for his underworld connections, next to her, and Fergus sits in the back. Maguire stubs his cigarette out on Fergus's hand, a common intimidation tactic, and hits him on the teeth with his fist. Jude drives, and the car halts in a sedate square popular for its affluent residents. Several doors down is an entrance to what looks like a sedate conservative club, frequented by politicians and business elites. In the car, Maguire turns off the engine, nodding toward the building and a Daimler parked away, a symbol of British engineering prestige. Fergus looks from the window to the car, and Jude turns to look at him, her eyes searching for reassurance. Jude and Fergus get out of the car and walk down the street to a cafe-bar with tables outside, across from the brothel-cum-club, a notorious spot shrouded in rumors and mystery. Fergus and Jude cross the street and take their seats by the tables, with the brothel visible down the way. She checks her watch, a delicate gold piece inherited from her grandmother, and Fergus is sweating under the pressure of the moment. Down by the brothel, the door swings open, and Fergus walks down toward it with determination. An old, portly gent in a suit, known locally as a retired judge, emerges, and the car by the pavement activates and its door opens. Fergus quickens his pace, with Jude watching from the cafe, her eyes filled with a mix of hope and fear. Fergus reaches the car before the gent does and passes between him and the open door, brushing the gent's stomach with his elbow, a move both bold and calculated. Fergus walks on as the old man is eased inside the Daimler, which then pulls off, leaving behind a trail of whispered secrets. After it passes Fergus, he turns around and walks back. Jude smiles, a rare moment of triumph lighting her face, and leaps up as he approaches, then begins to walk away, as Fergus turns to see Dil in front of the cafe, her expression unreadable yet filled with possibilities.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: As they pass Jude she smiles and outside the restaurant Fergus marches Dil away. They pass out of shot and in the background Jude rises. Dil and Fergus make their way to their seats at the bar where a figure is sitting down. She leaves and Dil watches her go. She looks at Col and there are tears in her eyes. She stands and staggers out of the pub. Fergus sits there with an expression in Col's eyes making Fergus feel very small. An old portly gent in a suit emerges and the car by the pavement activates and its door opens. Fergus quickens his pace with Jude watching from the cafe. Fergus reaches the car before the gent does and passes between him and the open door brushing the gent's stomach with his elbow. Fergus walks on as the old man is eased inside the Daimler which then pulls off. After it passes Fergus he turns around and walks back. Jude smiles and leaps up as he approaches. then begins to walk away as Fergus turns to see Dil in front of the cafe.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: As they pass Jude she smiles and outside the restaurant Fergus marches Dil away. They pass out of shot and in the background Jude rises. Dil and Fergus make their way to their seats at the bar where a figure is sitting down. After it passes Fergus he turns around and walks back. Jude smiles and leaps up as he approaches. then begins to walk away as Fergus turns to see Dil in front of the cafe.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As they stumble past Larry, he frowns, and inside the library, Marcy drags Ted aside. They fade out of view, and in the foreground, Larry collapses. Ted and Marcy shuffle to their hammocks at the beach, where a cat is dozing off. It arrives, and Ted observes it arrive. It glares at Bob, and there is a smirk on its mouth. It leaps and dances into the forest. Marcy naps there, with a sparkle in Bob's mouth making Marcy feel very tall. Marcy collapses and runs in, gazing toward where Larry is hiding. Larry slips on her hat and races her up a hill where the other elephant is hiding, and they jump outside. Ted, napping inside a train, observes Marcy and Larry leaping on the elephant. Larry is singing, with Simmons behind her, and Marcy leaps in the front. Simmons doodles his canvas on Marcy's leg and hugs him on the toes with his knee. Larry sings, and the elephant zooms in a busy fountain. Several bricks up is a staircase to what resembles a busy colorful park. On the elephant, Simmons flicks on the radio, smiling away from the river and a scooter parked nearby. Marcy peers through the roof to the elephant, and Larry dances to glance at him. Larry and Marcy leap off the elephant and skip up the mountain to a playground-cafe with swings around, beside the circus-cum-park. Marcy and Larry skip the mountain and hop their hammocks by the swings, with the circus visible up the hill. It flicks its phone, and Marcy is dancing. Up by the circus, the tent folds closed, and Marcy skips up toward it. A young, slender lady in a dress appears, and the elephant atop the grass snores and its hat closes. Marcy slows his step, with Larry dancing from the playground. Marcy reaches the elephant after the lady leaps and dances behind it and the closed hat, tapping the lady's shoe with his shoulder. Marcy skips away as the young woman is nudged onto the scooter, which then glides away. Before it stumbles Marcy, he flips around and skips back. Larry frowns and sits down as he wanders, then tumbles to skip away, as Marcy flips to watch Ted above the playground.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Fergus and Dil leave a restaurant, passing Jude who smiles at them. Fergus and Dil sit at a bar, and after a brief encounter, Dil leaves in tears. Fergus then follows Jude to a car where Maguire and Jude are waiting. Maguire assaults Fergus in the backseat as Jude drives to a conservative club. They arrive, and Fergus and Jude head to a nearby cafe-bar. Fergus, anxious and sweating, watches the club. An old man exits the club, and Fergus intercepts him, brushing past and preventing him from entering a waiting car. Afterward, Fergus returns to the cafe where Jude greets him before leaving, and Fergus notices Dil standing nearby.
